acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: It was classified as Category 1 with data of rat LC50: 40ppm (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Mouse
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 162 mg/g
REFERENCE SOURCE: PATTY(5th, 2001)

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: No data available on corrosion to metals

explosives.rationale: Not an explosive substance, though containing metal- oxygen (Os-O) bonds.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: It gave positive by DNA repair test for the in vitro data (PATTY (5th, 2001)), however, there was no in vivo data. Therefore we could not classify it.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Not classified in UNRTDG Class: 5.1 though it is an oxidizing agent.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Since there was no data of respiratory sensitization and skin sensitization, we could not classify about them.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid (melting point <= 140degC) substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Although it has bond of metals oxygen (Os-O), it is a class 6.1 in the UN classification. (It is not a class 4.2 (spontaneous combustibility)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since it was Category 1A-1C on the skin, and severe irritations are indicated in the human cases and also in the animals tests (ACGIH(2001),(PATTY(5th, 2001), it was set as Category 1.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as Category 1A-1C based on the information that it has corrosive effects and caused serious dermatitis and blister on human cases(ACGIH (2001)) and (PATTY (5th, 2001)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Since there was no data of respiratory sensitization and skin sensitization, we could not classify about them.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to wate (the water solubility is obtained)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (respiratory system),
Category 2 (kidney, liver, adrenal gland, spleen, hematopoietic system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney, liver, adrenal gland, spleen, hematopoietic system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Pulmonary edema is observed in the human case (ACGIH (2001)). In the animal studies, bronchial compression is observed in 50mg/kg  (45-60 days) dose to the rabbit (PATTY (5th, 2001)) and it was classified into Category 1 (respiratory systems) because of above results. Moreover, since prostration and denatures of liver, the sclerosis of a spleen, and the fatty degeneration of the kidney and the adrenal gland in 50mg/kg  (45-60 days) dose to a rabbit, and chronic anemia according to initial superactivity of marrow in 50mg/kg  (60 days) dose tothe guinea pig  were observed (PATTY (5th, 2001)), it was classified into Category 2 (kidney,liver,adrenal, spleen,hematopoietic systems).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (respiratory system, liver, kidney, adrenal gland, spleen)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (respiratory system, liver, kidney, adrenal gland, spleen)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Bronchitis, pulmonary edemas, and the denaturation pathological change of liver are seen in human cases (PATTY (5th, 2001)). So it is classified into Category 1 (respiratory systems, liver). Moreover, by the exposure test of the rabbit, although it was mainly seen in lungs in 125mg (24 - 28 h), in addition degeneration and hyperaemia was seen in liver, kidney, spleen, and adrenal gland. So it is classified into Category 1 (kidney, spleen, adrenal).
